title: Chinese government provides anti-epidemic materials to Botswana in September 2020
description: On September 10, 2020, the Chinese Government provided anti-epidemic materials  to the government of Botswana. These materials will be used for COVID-19 prevention efforts in Botswana. The specific amount and monetary value of this donation are unknown.   A handover ceremony was held for this donation. China’s Ambassador to Botswana, Zhao Yanbo, the Minister of Presidential Affairs, Kabo Morwaeng, Deputy Minister of Presidential Affairs, Dumezweni Mthimkhulu, and Minister of Health Dr. Edwin Dikoloti attended the ceremony.

# Title

# Description
On September 10, 2020, the Chinese Government provided anti-epidemic materials  to the government of Botswana. These materials will be used for COVID-19 prevention efforts in Botswana. The specific amount and monetary value of this donation are unknown.   A handover ceremony was held for this donation. China’s Ambassador to Botswana, Zhao Yanbo, the Minister of Presidential Affairs, Kabo Morwaeng, Deputy Minister of Presidential Affairs, Dumezweni Mthimkhulu, and Minister of Health Dr. Edwin Dikoloti attended the ceremony.

evidence: Anti-epidemic materials for COVID-19 prevention, healthcare focus

title: Chinese government provides anti-epidemic materials to Botswana in May 2020
description: On May 29, 2020, the Chinese government donated anti-epidemic materials to the government of Botswana. The materials included 15,000 protective medical face masks, 150,000 surgical masks, 3,000 medical protective isolation shoe covers, 5,000 pieces of disposable protective clothing, 7,000 medical protective goggles and 7,000 disposable sterilized rubber surgical gloves to the Government of Botswana. These materials will be used for COVID-19 prevention efforts by front-line anti-epidemic workers such as doctors, nurses, and border inspectors. The monetary value of this donation is unknown.  A handover ceremony was held for this donation at Sir Seretse Khama International Airport in Gaborone, Botswana on May 29, 2020. This batch of materials was delivered over two separate days with the first arrival being on May 29, 2020 and the second flight arriving on June 1, 2022. This unique delivery scenario was due to international flight capacity constraints. China’s Ambassador to Botswana Zhao Yanbo and Botswana Minister of Health went to the airport for the handover ceremony on May 29, 2020.
staff_comments: AidData has estimated the transaction amount for this donation based on price catalogues from the World Health Organization (WHO). Please see the TUFF Methodology for additional details.
combined_text:

The materials included 15,000 protective medical face masks, 150,000 surgical masks, 3,000 medical protective isolation shoe covers, 5,000 pieces of disposable protective clothing, 7,000 medical protective goggles and 7,000 disposable sterilized rubber surgical gloves to the Government of Botswana. These materials will be used for COVID-19 prevention efforts by front-line anti-epidemic workers such as doctors, nurses, and border inspectors. The monetary value of this donation is unknown.  A handover ceremony was held for this donation at Sir Seretse Khama International Airport in Gaborone, Botswana on May 29, 2020. This batch of materials was delivered over two separate days with the first arrival being on May 29, 2020 and the second flight arriving on June 1, 2022. This unique delivery scenario was due to international flight capacity constraints. China’s Ambassador to Botswana Zhao Yanbo and Botswana Minister of Health went to the airport for the handover ceremony on May 29, 2020.
justification: Project involves donation of medical supplies for COVID-19 prevention, with no direct environmental or energy transition impact
evidence: Donation of medical protective equipment, focus on healthcare and epidemic prevention

title: Chinese Embassy provides anti-epidemic materials to the Botswana Red Cross in May 2020
description: On May 15, 2020, the Chinese Embassy in Botswana handed over a donation of anti-epidemic materials to the Botswana Red Cross Society. According to the Chinese Embassy, the donated materials included masks, goggles, and protective suits. These materials will be used by BRCS staff for COVID-19 prevention efforts. The monetary value of this donation is unknown.

title: Chinese Embassy provides food relief donation to families in Gaborone, Botswana in May 2020
description: On May 8, 2020, the Chinese Embassy reported that it recently provided food relief to low income families in Gaborone, the capital of Botswana. According to the Embassy, this donation will assist more than 200 families in Botswana who have been negatively impacted by the COVID-19 pandemic. This donation was completed in partnership with the Gaborone City Council. The monetary value of this donation is unknown.  Following the donation, the Mayor of Gaborone sent a letter to Zhao Yanbo, the Chinese Ambassador to Botswana, thanking the Embassy for the donation.
combined_text:

According to the Embassy, this donation will assist more than 200 families in Botswana who have been negatively impacted by the COVID-19 pandemic. This donation was completed in partnership with the Gaborone City Council. The monetary value of this donation is unknown.  Following the donation, the Mayor of Gaborone sent a letter to Zhao Yanbo, the Chinese Ambassador to Botswana, thanking the Embassy for the donation.
justification: Project is a humanitarian aid initiative with no direct environmental or energy transition impact
evidence: Food relief donation to low income families, COVID-19 assistance, social development focus

title: Shandong Province provides anti-epidemic materials to Botswana in May 2020
description: On May 7, 2020, the Shandong Province in China provided anti-epidemic materials to Botswana. The materials included 30,000 surgical masks, 1,000 N95 masks, and 6,000 surgical gloves. These materials will be used for COVID-19 prevention efforts. The monetary value of this donation is unknown.  A handover ceremony took place for this donation at the Chinese Embassy in Botswana. Zhao Yanbo, China’s Ambassador to Botswana, and the Minister of Health and Wellness of Botswana attended the ceremony. The ceremony coincided with the 45th anniversary of diplomatic relations between China and Botswana.
staff_comments: AidData has estimated the transaction amount for this donation based on price catalogues from the World Health Organization (WHO). Please see the TUFF Methodology for additional details.

title: Chinese Embassy provides 10 sewing machines and 2 overlock machines to the Office of the First Lady of Botswana in August 2020
description: On August 24, 2020, the Chinese Embassy in Botswana provided 10 sewing machines and 2 overlock machines to the Office of the First Lady of Botswana. This donation is intended to improve the living standards of women and children affected by the COVID-19 pandemic by enabling them to produce masks and clothing. The monetary value of this donation is unknown.

title: China's Fujian Province provides the 16th medical team to Botswana in September 2020
description: On September 19, 2020, China's Fujian Province dispatched the 16th medical team to Botswana. The team consisted of 46 members and will be in Botswana for two years. The team was dispatched to Botswana to assist in COVID-19 treatment, prevention efforts, and general medical aid. According to the Fujian Government, by August 31, 2021, the team had received 26,971 outpatients, 14,015 inpatients, and performed 2,926 surgeries in Botswana.   On September 18, 2020, the Fujian Provincial Health Commission held a departure ceremony for the medical team. Ambassador Wang Xuefeng, Counselor Wang Bangfu, Counselor Yang Xunlei, all the staff of the Chinese Embassy in Botswana, Fang Shaoxiong , members of the Party Group of Fujian Provincial Health and Health Commission, and the members of the 16th medical aid team participated in the event.
combined_text:
# Sector
HEALTH

# Title
China's Fujian Province provides the 16th medical team to Botswana in September 2020

# Description
On September 19, 2020, China's Fujian Province dispatched the 16th medical team to Botswana. The team consisted of 46 members and will be in Botswana for two years. The team was dispatched to Botswana to assist in COVID-19 treatment, prevention efforts, and general medical aid. According to the Fujian Government, by August 31, 2021, the team had received 26,971 outpatients, 14,015 inpatients, and performed 2,926 surgeries in Botswana.   On September 18, 2020, the Fujian Provincial Health Commission held a departure ceremony for the medical team. Ambassador Wang Xuefeng, Counselor Wang Bangfu, Counselor Yang Xunlei, all the staff of the Chinese Embassy in Botswana, Fang Shaoxiong , members of the Party Group of Fujian Provincial Health and Health Commission, and the members of the 16th medical aid team participated in the event.
justification: Project is focused on medical aid and healthcare services without direct environmental or energy transition impacts
evidence: Medical team dispatched for COVID-19 treatment and general medical aid, healthcare focus

title: Shenzhen Government provides medical masks to Botswana in August 2020
description: On August 3, 2020, the Shenzhen Government donated medical masks to the Government of Botswana. This is part of a larger donation of 460,000 masks to 12 African countries, including Egypt, Togo, Ethiopia, Kenya, Zambia, Mali, Tunisia, Sudan, South Sudan, Botswana, Comoros and Cameroon. The specific amount of masks sent to Botswana is unknown. The monetary value of this donation is also unknown.
